title: Fraud Model Recall Decline Analysis for New Young Car Holders
description: Analysts must investigate the recall drop among new car holders under 30, validate segment distributions, audit pipeline noise and deliver their findings by June 3. The credit-limit model needs full CFPV explainability support by July 1 with audit-ready documentation flagged by July 7 and legal review before end of June; income model retraining launches immediately to finish by tomorrow evening with accuracy comparisons due Wednesday; three-tier risk model cutoffs and backend changes must be scoped and proposed by June 6 with success criteria defined alongside Michael, and the team will reconvene June 5 at 10 p.m.
prerequisites: Analysts ready by Tuesday, June 3rd
Validate distributions by segment after Justin’s pipeline update to the April pipeline
Full SHAF support and audit-ready documentation for the credit limit model ahead of CFPV explainability rules effective July 1st
Legal involvement before the end of June (added to the pre-audit checklist)
Completion of the income estimation model retraining pipeline before comparing pre- and post-accuracy
Preliminary cutoffs based on historical approval rates for the three-tier risk model
Michael’s validation of theory logic and definition of success criteria

title: Verify False Positives and Data Drift in Fraud Detection Pipeline
description: Investigate the fraud detection model’s performance drop (recall down from 0.87 to 0.79) and rising false positives among new car holders under 30 by performing a deep dive into potential data drift, profile shifts post-campaign and pipeline noise, validating distributions by segment. Analysts must complete the analysis and deliver their report by Tuesday, June 3.
prerequisites: Analysts ready by Tuesday, June 3rd
Access to the April pipeline update (to check for noise)

title: Prepare Fraud Model Analysis Report by June 3
description: Analyze the fraud detection model performance after recall fell from 0.87 to 0.79 among new car holders under 30, investigate rising false positives for potential data drift or profile shifts post-campaign, review recent pipeline changes, and validate distributions by segment. Deliver a detailed analysis report with findings and recommendations to the analysts by June 3.
prerequisites: Analysts need to be ready by Tuesday, June 3
Review the feature pipeline and Justin’s pipeline update to identify potential noise
Validate distributions by segment

title: Pipeline Noise Validation Across Customer Segments
description: Validate distributions across customer segments to identify noise introduced by the April pipeline update, with a deeper dive into segment-level drift and rising false positives (especially new car holders under 30). Analysts must prepare and deliver the full distribution reports by Tuesday, June 3.
prerequisites: Analysts need to be ready by Tuesday, June 3rd
Validate pipeline distributions by segment to identify noise introduced by the April/Justin pipeline update
Credit limit model documentation and dashboard must be finalized and audit-ready to comply with new CFPB explainability rules effective July 1st (walkthrough next Thursday, polish by July 7th)
Involve legal before the end of June (add to pre-audit checklist and schedule a short sync)
Retraining pipeline for the income estimation model must finish by tomorrow evening before comparing pre- and post-accuracy
Define preliminary cutoffs using historical approval rates to scope scoring backend changes (proposal due June 6th)
Work with Michael to validate theory logic and define success metrics

Schedule a pre-audit legal review before June 30 to ensure compliance with new CFPB rules.

Completion of the SHAP dashboard

Full SHAP support on the credit limit model

title: Retrain Income Estimation Model and Compare Accuracy
description: Kick off retraining of the income estimation model today via the pipeline and ensure it completes by tomorrow evening. Compare pre- and post-retraining accuracy metrics and compile the results. Deliver the accuracy comparison report by Wednesday.

Pipeline should finish by tomorrow evening

title: Design Simplified Three-Tier Risk Model for Instant Approvals

prerequisites: Access to historical approval rates
